intro: Saussurea crassifolia, commonly known as the Tibetan groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It is characterized by its robust, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cold, dry conditions. Its leaves are usually broad and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in its arid habitat. Saussurea crassifolia is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
